text:
Hi everyone, I have created new properties in the contacts called Hardware. So now I want to be able to call them into the website form but I couldn't find the correct endpoint for this, but I've tried this endpoint which did not work -
```<https://api.hubapi.com/properties/v1/contacts/properties/named/favorite_color?hapikey=demo>. ```
any ideas ?
Can you give a more advanced explenation? You'd like to update a contact property every time a form submit is done?
What does your call look like at the moment?

Hi all,
I've been fiddling with a tool to auto generate client libraries based on the new open api specs.
Would really like some input, especially on how to / if "they" should do something about operation ids.
Hope anyone would like to give the tool a spin. It can be cloned from here:
<https://github.com/lars-erik/markedspartner.HubSpot.net/tree/v2/main>
I've also provided some feedback on the developer announcement thread about open api.
Would love some discussion there as well. :innocent:
<https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/Developer-Announcements/Announcing-a-new-endpoint-that-returns-all-publicly-available/m-p/458092/highlight/true#M124>

</shameless-plug>
<@U020YUSCPMZ> Are you trying to do an api call to get a form, or a specific property?

If you do the following call, and add your api key, does it return the email property?
`/properties/v1/contacts/properties/named/email`

<https://api.hubapi.com/crm/v3/objects/deals?count=100&hapikey=APIKEY&property=hs_analytics_source&property=hs_analytics_source_data_1&property=hs_analytics_source_data_2&property=amount&property=dealtype|https://api.hubapi.com/crm/v3/objects/deals?count=100&hapikey=APIKEY&property=hs_ana[â€¦]=hs_analytics_source_data_2&property=amount&property=dealtype>
You have to make sure, that you're using the internal name as a parameter
Let me check
amount and dealtype are coming through, but none of the analytics fields are
Are you doing a POST or GET request?

<@U027N1RAENS>
If I do the following call:
`{{HubSpot API Url}}/crm/v3/objects/deals/search`
And I add the following request body:
`{`
    `"properties": [`
        `"hs_analytics_source",`
        `"hs_analytics_source_data_1",`
        `"hs_analytics_source_data_2"`        
    `],`
    `"limit": "100",`
    `"after": "0"`
`}`
I receive the fields
This is a POST call, different then you show
Get request to list all deals
Found it <@U027N1RAENS>
change 'property' to 'properties' :wink:

If you need more info, here's the documents page:
<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/crm/deals>
that did it, I think i was combining an old version of the API with the new one which was breaking things
thanks!
Worst part is, I had the same issue a couple of weeks ago
Np glad I could help!
Haven't checked it out deeply, but definitely giving an upvote, great work!
Is there a date parameter to filter GET requests by a specific date range? Using the CRM API for Deals and Contacts
Hi everyone, i'm integrated the api file upload in nodejs and this return me a 415 status, can you help me please?

Hi guys for our custom ecommerce site we'd like to associate products purchased with contacts, via the 'deals - line items'
We ran into that it's necessary to have 'professional' / 'enterprise' subscription for this. Would there be a different lightweight way of doing this, even if it wasn't as nice as doing it with the product library / objects?

Thank you ! :slightly_smiling_face:
